Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera, few pitfalls to watch out for.
Reviews.Author: Erik Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about two weeks now and so far its been great to use.The 8x zoom is great, I used to have a sony p10 that I upgraded from that was only 3x, this makes a huge difference getting those "up close and personal" shots from a distance.The image quality is...incredible.  I'll admit I've not used anything over an 8MP camera but I can't imagine other 14MP camera's could be much better.  The level of detail in the pictures is incredible.That being said other reviews have taken issue with the low light capability and I have to agree with them....sorta.  The iA (intelligent auto) feature doesn't seem to do a great job on its own in low lighting conditions.  However if you select one of the scene modes and use a tripod, I've found the camera comes out with an acceptable quality even in low light.Building on that, the iA feature fo the camera does an excellent job most of the time picking out the best settings (fstop/iso/shutter speed), its worlds better then anything in the point and shoot category that I've used before. The only spot where I've had to tell it what scene setting to use (in daylight anyway) is the sports mode.  It's fast enough to capture my ceiling fan blades with little blur , excellent for a point and shoot.The SDXC slot future proofs the camera and the speed of the cards allows for decent burst mode shooting capability.  The battery seems to hold a decent charge and the lcd is huge so you can easily see what your shooting.Some people have dinged the camera since it doesn't have a viewfinder but seeing as how there are no real manual controls on this camera (other then iso/exposure) I don't see too many serious professionals who need a viewfinder buying this camera as anything other then a small easy to carry point and shoot.Several years ago I would have laughed if you would have said that you could get an 8x zoom, 14MP, huge LCD at this price point and build quality....I'm not laughing any more.All in all, excellent camera and certainly recommended (low light being the kinda sorta exception). 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: T. Walters
Reviews.Content: I received this camera last week, and I'm very happy with it. I previously used a very simple Kodak EasyShare, but wanted something that would give me more zoom, and would allow me to take better close up photos.I was a little concerned about purchasing a camera that had on-screen modes (that little Kodak wheel is so easy to use) but this has proved to be no problem at all. The on-screen modes are easy to read and understand(the icons are adjustable to be either be large or small).I love having the entire user manual as part of the software - it was easy to read through the manual and get a good overview of the camera, and then be able to learn the more detailed features at leisure.I have mostly used the Intelligent Auto mode and the macro setting and the zoom as well. I took a number of pictures of our 3-month old grandchild (okay, full disclosure, I took 74 pictures of our grandchild the first time I used the camera)in a variety of light. The pictures are just stunning. Clear, detailed, every eyelash shows up.I purchased an 8GB class 6 card with the camera which I think gives me a fast save, and I can take picture after picture so quickly (the time the picture displays after it is taken can be adjusted on the camera from no time to 2 seconds) so I was able to catch lots of smiles. The camera is heavier than I expected (a good thing for stability for me) since so much of it is metal. I love the battery and usb port compartments because they are sturdy yet easy to open and close. I have posted some pics online, and they are beautiful on the screen. I had a number of them printed as well, and they look just as great. I'm amazed at the clarity of the photos taken with the zoom.In some reviews, reviewers have complained about not having a viewfinder and having trouble seeing the screen in sunlight. According to the manual, there is a setting for the screen that makes it easier to see in bright sunlight. If it ever gets sunny here, I will try that out. So far battery time is good, so I will wait to see if I need a backup battery or not. I'm looking forward to using additional modes and learning more about the camera.It is just plain fun for me to use, and I'm very glad to have this camera. I hope this review is helpful to others - I read many, many reviews before I purchased the camera, and I appreciated everyone who took the time to write one.One other thing, Amazon suggested a Case Logic camera case to purchase with the camera, and I did buy it. It's a nice little case and the camera just fits, but since I will want to keep the charger and possibly the usb cord with me, I will continue to use my larger case. I'm going to keep my cordless laptop mouse in the small case instead.Update April 3, 2011: It's been a month since I purchased my camera and the more I use it the more I love it. Although I use the IA a lot, I'm getting more familiar with the modes for certain photo situations, and now it's almost effortless to change modes, adjust settings, etc. I took some close up photos of flowers today (indoors), and they are by far the clearest, most detailed closeup photos I've ever taken. So far because of weather-related issues, I have taken only one or two outdoor photos, so I'm getting really excited about taking the camera outdoors soon.

Reviews.Title: Great Backup Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Quinlan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to backup my Lumix DMC FZ28.  To use in situations where I don't want tocarry the larger camera and for my wife to use.  The FH20 is easy to use (settings, functions,descriptions very similar to the FZ28.  So the learning curve is simple).  The stabilization inthis camera is terrific.  The lens is sharp and the Intellegent Exposure mode is excellent in all the situations I have tested so far!  Bottom line is that the DMC-FH20 is everything Iwanted for a backup.  Great camera, Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera at this price
Reviews.Author: J. Walker
Reviews.Content: I have owned quite a few Panasonic cameras over the years. They have all been the point-and-shoot variety like this one. I purchased this in Sept 2010 and have taken over 3000 photos with it under many different conditions.On the positive:  Battery life is good. Previous Panasonics used AA batteries--which is nice because you can buy spares to use in a pinch if your rechargables run out. But I found the AAs don't last as long, they don't have as many recharges in them, and they are certainly heavier than the included Li-Ion battery.  Wide zoom is great. This feature should be on every camera. When set to 16:9 ratio, you get a lot more in your photo. We don't print many photos--most are viewed on a HDTV, so 16:9 ratio is perfect.  Image stabilization is good. Nearly every camera has this now, but in the early days, Panasonic was among the first. And it remains one of the best in the business.  The time it takes from turning it on to taking a photo is very short. Also, the time between photos (no flash) is very good.  The scene menu is nice. If you want quick settings without messing with the camera too much, they are handy.On the negative:  I wish this camera took better photos in low light. This is the bane of most point-and-shoot cameras. The industry bombarded everybody with megapixel and zooom numbers, but failed to explain sensor sizes/ratios. But unless you get a SLR camera, you will probably not get great low-light photos.  The HD video isn't that great. Others have discussed it here, so I won't go into it. You won't be replacing your video camera with this, but if all you bring is this camera to a party, or happen to stumble on an impromptu parade in Italy, this will do a fine job of capturing the moment. I would rather have adequate video with great photos than great video with (barely) adequate photos (as most video cameras do).Considering how many people think that their cellphone cameras take fine pictures, don't get too hung up on the nitpicking about the picture quality. It will be a fine camera for 95% of the people--and besides, it will be obsolete in a couple of years anyway, right?

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: MK Man
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a month and could not be happier.  It is very easy to use and takes quality photos.  The video's come out great. Sure it has a few minor shortcomings but, what camera does not ?  For a under $200 camera you can not go wrong with the DMC-FH20.

Reviews.Title: HD video is a gimmick. Pictures just OK. Too many limitations.
Reviews.Author: Julien Pierre "Software engineer and amateur ...
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at a local retailer. I was mainly attracted by its HD video feature. I wanted to use it in addition to my camcorder to record myself playing the piano, indoors of course.Unfortunately, I was severely disappointed by the video quality. On my first video, the whole picture was yellow, clearly a white balance problem.On my second video, with the DMC-FH20 set on a tripod, everything was blinking, including the piano lid, which should have been a solid black. Even though there are 1280x720 pixels at 30fps, the quality is barely better than what you get from a typical camera phone. And it is inferior to my Logitech Quickcam Pro 9000 webcam.Also, another thing to know is that you can't change the zoom while recording video. You have to stop the recording, change the zoom setting, and then start recording again. This didn't bother me for the piano recording since I was recording myself, but you should know about this limitation - this camera is no camcorder.One more limitation in video is that the camera records in Quicktime (motion JPEG) format, but not AVC HD. This causes files to be large. I'm not sure if the Quicktime CODEC contributes to the poor video quality also, but it might.When it comes to still picture quality, they come out very noisy indoors without the flash. With the flash on, they are actually OK. But I'm not sure that having 14 megapixels on such a small sensor really adds much. 8-10 would probably be just fine and might have less noise.I returned the camera mainly because I couldn't stand the video quality. As a still camera I might have kept it, but I wouldn't have paid as much for it, and I was hoping to minimize the number of photo/video devices I own.Pros :- 8x optical zoom which is better than most compact cameras- pocketable size- Future-proof SDXC card slot- OK pictures with the flashCons :- Poor low-light performance without flash- Poor video quality, not HD quality by any stretch of the imagination- Zoom can't be changed during video recording- Proprietary lithium-ion battery- No optical or electronic viewfinder, only LCD screen

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor nightime shots, zoom quality better than most
Reviews.Author: Not Tech Savy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera prior to a family reunion.  Was pleased with the ease as I am not tech savy.  I did not use the HD video so can't say anything about that.  Was very happy with outdoor night time flash shots - both of people and things.  Indoor pictures were good - the zoom images were better than the Cybershot camera I had before.  Price was reasonable and battery held up well. Would recommend to others for an easy to use camera that produces good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Review at new low price..You cannot beat this camera for this price
Reviews.Author: T-Time
Reviews.Content: Great camera...Low light shots are not great..Not as good as the stellar reviews but NO CAMERA under $200 is.It is a steal at under $150..At $119 it is a no brainer..If you need a new camera GET THISWith flash night shots are good..Range of flash is a bit lower than some cameras thoughThe IA auto feature is 99% perfect..It selects the proper settings for you and does a remarkable job..You will be taking picture(good ones) within minutes.It has around 25 different presets to choose from if you want to do that also..these are what the IA uses..it determines which one to use..It is very fast..Auto focus is almost instant..It has burst mode that actually works well..Taking pics at 3mp rapidly..8x optical zoom is just unheard of for under $200..The video mode is HD or SD..the HD is motion Jpeg which saves as a .mov quicktime file..Not true HD and no HMDI on camera..it does have RCA plug to connect to tv and of course you can always upload to computer and use them there..NO zooming While making movies..You can set the zoom before you start and I think you can pause recording and adjust zoom then start again ..All I can think of..Still playing with all the features...

Reviews.Title: would buy again in a heartbeat
Reviews.Author: Snobun
Reviews.Content: I researched subcompact digital cameras for 2 years.  This one met all my criteria and expectations: it takes excellent photographs under low light conditions for a small camera.  It even takes better photos under low light than my Nikon D40 SLR.  It is responsive, easy to use, very transportable, and I did not need to 'learn' anything in order to use it (unlike my D40 Nikon SLR).  I cannot recommend it highly enough for those wanting excellent photos within the bounds of what a subcompact can give them, although so far I haven't really found any limitations.  The macro-feature  allows me to focus on the fibers in my tablecloth!  How much closer do I need to get?!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I've had other similar Panasonic cameras and been pleased with all of them. I'm looking for snapshots, not high art and this does what it does very well. I particularly like the wide angle, which, until recently, has only been available on much more expensive cameras. Panasonic has more competition now from cameras with similar features, but it is still a very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: eshopper "L.C."
Reviews.Content: Does everything as advertised.  Very happy with it.  Good Price.  Easy to use.  Maybe it's just me but it seems that the battery had to be recharged sooner than I expected.  It lasted quite a while, though so not really a complaint.  Recharges very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: ron
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of the camera and it was chosen as the digital camera of the year.  So far I agree with the reviews.

Reviews.Title: How Electronics Expo screwed me on this camera
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say the camera is fine. But let me tell you how Electronics Expo the seller that supplied this item to Amazon Screwed me.  I paid extra money to get 2 day shipping. Took 10 days for it to arrive. The Electronics Expo asked me to leave feedback on my purchase , which I did.  It wasn't great feedback but it wasn't real bad either.  I got several emails from a guy named Bruno asking me to change my feedback.  He offered me $20.00 dollars back on my purchase to remove the feedback.  Well I did remove it like he asked.  Now as of yet I have not been paid back and he will not my emails. I am pretty sure that this review wont get posted but it may at least get seen by someone at Amazon.com  I will also post this everywhere else I can that it may be shared with other online shoppers. Jack B.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, but not without it's flaws
Reviews.Author: Tara S
Reviews.Content: We have been using this camera for a year now, and it's definitely been a great buy. The pictures are sharp, features are easy to use, downloads to the PC are quick and painless. Software included is simple to use.We've used this in numerous situations so far, out and about, indoors, outdoors, action shots, portrait shots, low light, bright light and it seems to have handled 95% of the pictures wonderfully.  The only drawback is that on occasion, focusing can be a bit slow, especially when you are using the flash.We have dropped this camera a few times, it's been exposed to cold and hot and it still works just as good as the day it arrived. Definitely has been a great purchase.Update: We've had this camera for a almost two years now, and it's still going strong.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 mp camera
Reviews.Author: jasmine
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  The pictures come wonderfully clear and sharp in beautiful color.  The video is lovely.  I did a lot of research before deciding on this model.  It was a close decision between this model and the Canon. This camera had a great price and I'm so glad I got this.Amazon did a good job delivering this product on time and the camera was in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Awesome inexpensive digital.
Reviews.Author: Avg Guy
Reviews.Content: Fairly fast lens. Good low light and stabilization with no flash. Proprietary usb cable. I would rather have a mini or micro usb. I would recommend this to all friends shopping in this price range. It replaced my trusty canon sd550 only b/c my lcd broke while snowboarding.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Deane Karstaedt
Reviews.Content: Years ago I did a lot of photogaphy using German 35mm's with a bag full of lenses.  Over the years we've had a lot of different cameras, and this is flat out the best camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera.
Reviews.Author: mutts2
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a very good point-shoot compact digital with HIGH ZOOM (10x+).  That immediately eliminated many p-s models as the zoom was below 5x.  I decided to buy this unit at 8x zoom based on reviews and price.I am VERY happy with this camera.  It has more bells/whistles than I will use, but take FANTASTIC photos in ALL conditions I've tested.Additionally, a pleasant surprise is that you get INCREASED optical zoom capability if you decrease the pixel size of the photo.  A 3Mg setting will allow for 16x zoom !!!  Very nice.Photo A no zoom, Photo B, 16x zoom (1024x768 photo size)[...]I don't typically write reviews, but I DO read them and they DO influence my decision to purchase.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointing image quality
Reviews.Author: Andy Rooney "Andy"
Reviews.Content: I used the Lumix FH20 for a few days in a variety of circumstances and ended up returning the camera because the images were just not acceptable to me. Image quality is somewhat subjective so many may find this camera does the job for them.I wanted a small camera for general use since my normal camera (Kodak P880) is a bit large at times. I have been taking pictures for years and got used to the functionality and results of an SLR, but have to admit I miss a lot of photo chances because of the extra work involved with that format. Hence the pocket size and excellent zoom range of the Lumix were attractive. My daughter has a Lumix that takes great pictures, so my expectations were high.The images I got back were just too blurry, especially at the far end of the zoom range and the purple fringing was noticeable even at normal viewing in some cases. In most cases the shutter speed was plenty fast so that was not the issue. It was either the lens was not up to the task or the auto focus was at fault. I had hoped to be able to attach some samples to this review, but apparently that is not an option.I must admit this is my first 'point and shoot' camera and in most cases, it was 'point and hope'. I was not able to see the LCD screen in full sunlight and frankly don't see how anyone can use these things outdoors. I looked for a way to increase the LCD brightness, but I don't think there is one. My first digital camera had a simple optical viewfinder. Why has this feature been left off almost all new cameras?One tip for users of this camera, I found that the camera tends to overexpose outdoor shots and I liked the results better when setting the exposure to -1 or -1.5. Anyway I am still looking for a small format camera I can use.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Element
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth between purchasing this camera and a more expensive Lumix, such as the zX5 or ZX7. My previous camera was a Sony Cybershot T-33 with a Carl Zeiss lens, and I was so impressed by it that I thought that I needed the Leica lens in a Lumix. (There were just a few things I never did love about my Sony, so when it broke after 4 years of use, I decided to replace it with a different brand.)I paid about $150 for my Cybershot back in 2006 (it was a 5MP) so I was looking to spend about the same amount this time around.Well, I wish I would have spent a little more on the Lumix. I think the Leica lens would have made a difference. This little guy is a great value, indeed, and it takes a perfectly good picture, it just doesn't have that "pop" that my Sony did. The color is maybe a little flatter, the pictures not quite as sharp. I do like it, and I'm going to keep it, but for anyone else on the fence between this one and a slightly more expensive Lumix, I would say "pass this deal up and go get the Leica lens."For anyone who just wants a nice camera for a little over a hundred bucks, this is a good deal and you will probably like it. It's got a great zoom, and the iA feature really makes it easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Wegman
Reviews.Content: i wanted an out of the box professional quality pics point and shoot, and i just about got it. sure there are settings on a dslr that are missing from this camera, but its a point and shoot. for someone like me with no photography experience that just wants great pics of the kids, this camera is perfection. easy to set up, easy to use. i love the intelligent auto, i just leave it on that and shoot away. i love the burst mode for chasing the kids (literally LOL) and overall i am very happy with this purchase.UPDATE 4-10-11took this camera to NYC for a weekend trip, and got some incredible pictures. it started to slow down here and there, and delay going into zoom, and also slowed down switching from shooting mode to review mode, but other than that it was great. battery life good to almost great, i shot most of the first day on a partially charged battery, and through the second with a full charge. (i had 2) took about 500 pics total. burst mode came in handy for times square, and the video was great in the cab. (showing the crazy traffic) at battery park i got up close and personal with lady liberty with the zoom. just incredible.  (thats across the water for you non new yorkers)  still in love with this camera.UPDATE 5-11-13. still loving this camera. i've moved beyond taking JUST pics of the kids, and am taking product shots for my etsy store, and while its still not a dslr, i can get some pretty good results with a lightbox and minimal photo editing (color correction etc) macro mode works well to capture the details of my crochet work, and overall, i'm still very happy with it. it has slowed down quite a bit in taking pictures since i got it, and i will probably have to see what i can do to fix that (reformat the sd card perhaps?) when i replace it (probably next year) i will pass it to my oldest daughter.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: K. ONeil
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a top of the line point and shoot camera.  This was more than I had hoped for.  Very user friendly and great options for the more advanced user make this camera the best I have had thus far.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy M. Reier
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything I need.  The 8x zoom is great.  Much better than others I have had.  Good features.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy In Vermont
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, pocket sized with large zoom, great image stabilization and crisp, clear images.  What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: nice technology, poor construction
Reviews.Author: hardgarrison
Reviews.Content: Have owned this camer for about a year now. I really like th ease of use, and wspeciall the fast focus ability.  The IA quick setting is really nice when I have had it set for something special, and want to get back to a fast point and shoot mode in a hurry.The main downfall is the design of the cover for the battery compartment and memory card.  It opens way to easy when bumped just right and is spring loaded so it pops all the way open right away. If you are not careful it is easy to break off, especially if you keep the camera in a purse or pocket when in the field.Overall I am very happy with the picture quality for my needs,  but am disapointed Panasonic did not spend a little more time engineering the battery compartment cover, to last longer, or at least be able to be replaced easily by the consumer.

Reviews.Title: Decent simple camera for cost, not great quality though.
Reviews.Author: Sam Bleuel
Reviews.Content: This camera was a major improvement from my Fujifilm Finepix A850 and I paid less for it. (Got it for $71 as a customer return on eBay)It CAN take amazing quality photos with the right settings when iA doesn't work so well.It does tend to have noisey low-light photos as well as night photos, but that's to be expected. It's not so bad with the flash.For a simple point and shoot, this is probably the best to get.I can agree on the HD video not being so HD though. It tends to be a bit redish indoors, defiantly a white balance problem. I tried changing the white balance but the other settings looked worse.The 8x zoom feature is pretty awesome, works well.Takes good photos of close up objects and really bright things (TV screen, etc).It's one of those cameras that can focus in on the subject and blur out the rest, I love that.It's visually appealing, well built, and less bulky than my old camera. Battery lasts longer than my old one too.It also shows really fine detail in photos, a great feature. It showed the fine lines in my hands even when zoomed in. Most of the time, the pictures are the same color as the scene itself, also nice.There's no lag in the shutter and takes pictures quickly too.For the most part, this camera is great quality for the price and would defiantly recommend it for someone looking for a simple point and shoot.UPDATE:I've had it for a bit now and have noticed more flaws that I'm not liking.One, in indoor photos, it tends to have a redish tint- in both photo and video. (Video quality is also pretty horrible indoors)When trying to take closer up photos, there's a constant dark shadow in the bottom left corner.I've noticed low-light photos (indoor and night) are just horrible.Also, in working with this camera more- I've taken note that the higher zoom you go, the worse the quality of the picture gets. I wouldn't take photos past the 4x zoom.This camera was an improvement from my previous camera but I'm defiantly glad I'm getting the Nikon Coolpix P300.I would no longer recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for catching baby smiles =)
Reviews.Author: Whit
Reviews.Content: I honestly have only one complaint about this camera -- the speed of the burst mode is a little slower than I would have hoped. It's a little under 1 shot/second, which doesn't catch quick movements very well. It's also a little blurry if you're not perfectly still and if the lighting isn't great.Everything else is wonderful. We bought this camera so we could catch our son's smiles for his grandparents, and it has definitely done that and more. The HD video is excellent, but does take a while to load onto your computer; the great thing is you can switch video quality easily ... but you can read about most of the features in the product description.I was most worried about choosing the right SD card. We ended up going with Transcend's SDHC 8 gb card, 10 class. I would recommend getting at least 8 gb or higher for this camera. And with the class 10, it never slows the camera down.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality overall, but with a couple of issues
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Bassi
Reviews.Content: Image quality is super!!. My friends can't believe this is a point and shot camera when they see my pictures (specially daylight ones).There are two problems why is put 4 instead of 5 stars:1) Included battery has very low capacity, this is made for the suer to buy the high capacity battery they have on catalog. I went to Disneyland, I charged the night before and I reach one battery line at afternoon. So for a whole day, you need two batteries (or maybe the high capacity one). So take this into account for long trips.2) The lens, when extended, makes a shadow on some close up pictures when flash is used. I saw a shadow on a lot of pictures, every time on the bottom left corner, Now I realized that it was because of the lens.I am very happy with this camera, except for the included battery.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Beverly Garcia
Reviews.Content: My son is a camera critic and choose this one for easy access when riding his Indian Bike cross country.  The included rechargeable battery really holds the charge for a long time.  It's easy to carry and he even uses it for family get togethers.  The price is cheap for the quality of pictures that this little camera takes.  I highly recommend this one! :D

Reviews.Title: A great "constant companion" camera.
Reviews.Author: Dr. James M. Peterson
Reviews.Content: As someone once said, the best camera is the one you have with you when you want it. This small, very capable little camera fits that bill well; it is of a very handy size for purse, jacket pocket or belt. I find myself taking the camera with me everywhere, often using it as a sort of "visual notepad," for example taking pictures of things that need attention or repair in the house or yard. The 8x lens is magnificent, the controls are easy and accessible. After having this camera for 2 or 3 days, I bought one for my wife, and was able to show her the basics of using it in about 2 minutes. It has an auto setting feature that works for about 95% of the pictures you will take, or you can use the overrides to take control. Image stabilization is very good. I haven't experimented with the video as yet. Photo file transfers via usb-2 are very fast into my Macbook Pro's iPhoto program. All in all, there is very little wrong with this camera. 8x is probably the maximal lens range that makes sense in a small pocket camera-- the higher-power zooms are not really practical in cameras of this size, tending to produce some distortion.

Reviews.Title: Awesome 1st Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: T.C.
Reviews.Content: I had a bad experience with a digital camera in the past that I bought on impulse on black Friday that failed on so many levels. I did my research and found this to be one of the better point and shoot cameras for people that casually take pictures and some video. It has a max resolution of 14 MP so the pictures taken can be zoomed in quite a bit and on more than one occasion it's helped me read far away signs. There are actually four video modes which can be selected appropriately depending on film time although it still has the drawback of not being able to zoom while filming. All the buttons are arranged nicely and can be comfortably operated with one hand and the playback on the camera is fantastic. I've actually been able to take more than 300 photos on one charge but it all depends on whether you use flash for every photo. For the price and features, I would highly recommend this camera for those casual picture takers as well as being an excellent first point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Good!
Reviews.Author: LG
Reviews.Content: Amazing upgrade from my Nikon Coolpix's grainy, blurry, yellow photos. Pictures are sharp and clear thanks to the image stabilizer an the IA mode does just about everything (close up, low light, portrait, outdoors). I know this camera has some extra features I can perfect my photos with as well! Great inexpensive camera that feels very sturdy and well made, it's hard to beat an 8x optical zoom on a sub-$200 model. Overall an excellent camera for the novice photographer just wanting to get crisp pictures of their friends and events.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera..best buy!! reccomend it..
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Sanquintin "BASS FREAK"
Reviews.Content: I love my camera and is jsu the right size for me..the price was reasonable too....thanks!!

Reviews.Title: Broke after 3 months
Reviews.Author: Lisandra Ann Morales "book lover"
Reviews.Content: I wasn't very impressed with this camera from the start.  All I want a digital camera for is to take pictures of my son and daughter.  Many times the pictures would be blurry or I would think they were perfect, but after uploading them on my computer and trying to enlarge the image the results would look cheap and blurry.  Then, on summer vacation, I turned on the camera.  It tried to open but it couldn't.  It was stuck and an error message would show on screen.  Amazon was unable to refund or exchange the camera since it happened 3 months after purchase.  I doubt I buy a Panasonic camera ever again.  I prefer Kodak.

Reviews.Title: compact camera with picture quality issue
Reviews.Author: Yifan Wang
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for a few month, and produced 100+ photoGood:1. compact size2. 28mm wide angle lens3. low priceBad:1. Auto White balance miscalculates most of time for indoor photo with flash. Background appears RED or Yellow!2. Flash is unusually weak. Object more than 6 feet away may appear "dark". This is my biggest problem.3. It may under exposure in Outdoor pictures too4. Maximum Aperture is f/3.3 = SLOW cameraI don't ask for much for a compact camera but this camera has flaws:1. metering & White balance problems2. flash range is too shortOnce my Canon A620 is fixed, I may have to give up this Lumix.Here is update after additional use of this camera:I think I overlooked the fact that unlike other brands, this model offers Maximum Aperturef/3.3 while other models can offer f/2.8. This explains why the image quality is so poor when flash is off. The camera has to take long shutter speed to capture an image.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: sixtiesgirl
Reviews.Content: I love how easy this camera is to use even without looking at the manual. I followed another customer's advice and got the 32GB card so that the videos come out smooth and there's plenty of room for photos. The only 2 cons which are not the big of a deal to me are: the screen is hard to see when taking a picture in bright daylight(just like my previous Sony Cybershot). Also, when filming you can't use the zoom unless you stop filming and zoom in before filming again. I'm very happy with the wonderful detail in the photos.I would highly recommend this camera for the value.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Singer
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before deciding on this camera. Amazon had the best price on a huge selection of cameras at many different price points. I've had the camera for a while now and it continues to deliver high quality pictures with ease.

Reviews.Title: good panasonic lumix
Reviews.Author: victor angeles
Reviews.Content: very good. have 4 year good work, panasonic is best, i will again buy last modern camera digital panasonic!is goood

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: dg
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what I purchased it to do.  There are those times when you don't want to lug a DSLR around and this one fits into a shirt pocket and still produces much better pictures than the camera in an iPhone 5.  Menu is reasonable, and the computer interface works well.  Battery life is OK too, and charges very fast.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Russ "Period Piece Princess"
Reviews.Content: At first I was not pleased with this camera.  I was planning a trip to Alaska and decided to look for another camera.  I compared the clarity of the view with mine and found mine was clearer.  Then I realized it was me that was not doing a good job.  A little ways over I saw a Panasonic Lumix display for newer cameras.  I watched the video and they talked about the "iA" setting.  On the new ones it is on the setting wheel. But on mine it beside the shutter button.  I tried it and my pictures where perfect.  People love my photos from Alaska and I am so pleased.  BUT I was having problems with the shutter not opening properly so I had to manually open it.  But for some reason (after several months) it is back to working automatically so I have no idea what is going on.  But it is a camera that is worth the bother as the pictures are wonderful.  USE the "iA" setting: intelligent Auto

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Eiswirth
Reviews.Content: Takes great photos and videos, has lots of helpful modes and features. I like it a lot and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Relaxng
Reviews.Content: This a very good camera, lightweight and comfortable to use.  Typical though is using the rear screen to view the shot outdoors is guess work.  These small cameras need to have the eye view finder for outdoor use...

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: DTwo77
Reviews.Content: Camera was rated very high in Consumer Reports.  I can see why.  It is an excellent camera for the price and very user friendly.  Picture quality is excellent as is the shutter speed compared to my old Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H9.  The only negative for me would be the size.  It is about the size of a pack of cigaretttes and for someone with large hands, it may be a little awkward to use.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix SMC-fh20
Reviews.Author: Calsgrama
Reviews.Content: I like the size of the camera, it has a nice feel to it.  Not so light I don't know it's there.  I am impressed with the shutter speed, it captures movements well.  I don't like the length between shots...but burst mode helps.  The pictures are clear even with the zoom fully extended.  I do "lighten" the shot in editing a lot.  But I like a bright picture.I wanted a camera to put in my pocket and this fits perfectly.  I would have given it five stars except for the wait time between pictures, but to tell the truth I would rather have the lag between pictures than have lag in the shutter speed.

Reviews.Title: Ease of use; High quality images
Reviews.Author: George M. Meiser "bel canto fan"
Reviews.Content: As of this writing, I own 3 of these cameras and have not had an atom of trouble with any of them.  My collection of cameras numbers 36 units, from an 1894 KodakPanorama...to an 8 by 10 View Camera to top-of-the-line Nikons.  Like many, I portedmy gear around in a large camera bag that increasingly was becoming burdensome.  Twomajor insidents occurred that I should have photographed but couldn't because of notbothering to grab "the big bag."  This prompted me to buy a small camera of reasonable quality that could be kept under the car seat for emergencies.  After reading reviews, my choice was the Panasonic Lumix 8X - 14megapixel.  I already hadone of the large Leica Lumix units that produces super images.  When "the little Lumix" arrived, I stood on the front porch and shot a road sign half a block away.Enlarged, the image was surprisingly sharp, so I got the large Lumix and shot thesame view.  8 by 10 enlargements of both images revealed VERY little difference.  Bottom line is that I've only used the big Lumix twice in the last year.  The image quality of the DMC-FH20 is so impressive I've been using it to take nearly allcontemporary photos used in my photo-history-book series "The Passing Scene." NOT INCIDENTALLY,the FH20 can be used to make high-quality HAND-HELD quick copies ofold photos, which is so much more convenient than scanning each one.  HOWEVER, thebiggest surprise is the HD quality of the videos, both in sight and sound. If you doubt me for a second, go to YouTube and watch: [...] DO WATCH this video in YouTube's highest HD setting.  Light was poor in the room and making a video was a snap decision.  Changing the setting from photo to video can be done in 4 seconds.  Results?  You can read the music charts in the back of the room and sound quality speaks for itself.  Astounding!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Big Daddy
Reviews.Content: Real easy to use, and the picture quality is great.  Outdoor shots show more intense colors.  Zoom works great but the more you zoom the harder it is to stabilize and the picture quality suffers.  So a tripod might be in order, but that will never happen with me.  I bought this Panasonic camera for my last vacation to the beach so I could guarantee more pictures of my wife....I succeeded.  We also have a higher end point and shoot Panasonic camaera that we both like very much, which is why I landed the smaller model for myself.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Maverick from sky
Reviews.Content: I had very high recommendation on this camera. After purchase, this little guy performed wonder for me. In this budget, no other camera can give you the quality like this. It is best in its class (in its price range)

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera at a Low Price with Lots of Features
Reviews.Author: J. Mertes "AZShopaholic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 to replace my old 1990s Fuji Finepix digital camera. I took it on vacation in May and couldn't be happier. It's intuitive to use and takes incredibly clear, wonderful pictures. I used it daily for a week, and the battery lasted the entire time - it's a good thing, because we were in Europe and didn't have a voltage adapter to use with the battery charger, which plugs into a wall socket. This little camera is compact enough to fit in a purse or pocket and has been a dream to use. The digital movies are good, not HD, but just fine for my purposes. No stability feature, unfortunately, so the short movies I took while walking or driving had some bumpiness. I simply don't have any complaints - it does what it's advertised to do, and my photos are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera! purchased from Amazon
Reviews.Author: mini mary
Reviews.Content: I still am learning,but it has tons of features and is fairly easy to use for a non -tecky like me.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but no USB charging!
Reviews.Author: Lamonster
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and it takes great pics and great video but I hate that I can't charge it when I plug it in to USB. Why would they use a USB data cable and not charge the unit while you're downloading your pics? I would give this a 5 star rating if it wasn't for that.

Reviews.Title: excellent value for money
Reviews.Author: Kanthi
Reviews.Content: this is the best camera for this prize range.. I got it in amazon for 130 bucks...great pictures... of course you cannot expect great quality during night time...but not the worst..nice response time..

Reviews.Title: Pretty Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: spm009
Reviews.Content: This takes really nice pictures for a digital camera. I found that pictures using the zoom is hit or miss. Sometimes you get really nice pictures, sometimes they are blurry, sometimes they are terrible. It has numerous settings, such as sunset, night sky, portrait, etc... so that the unskilled picture-taker can capture a variety of different moments with success.

Reviews.Title: Not what I had expected...
Reviews.Author: GFCF Mommy
Reviews.Content: I was fully prepared to love this camera. I have had an older Lumix for yrs now that I have really enjoyed, but that one has seen better days.To start off with, the picture quality was very grainy, which surprised me. Plus the color seemed off in all the test pictures I took. I tried different settings on the camera, but it didn't help. I had hoped to get the crisp picture quality that I was used to. On the other hand, this camera is lovely and much smaller than my older camera. However, I would rather have a great bulky camera, than a gorgeous paperweight.I have since returned this camera and I am again searching around for another one. Thank goodness Amazon has such a good return policy.

Reviews.Title: Just a Excellent and easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: william hankins
Reviews.Content: I have not had a camera for twenty years but I needed one for a special occassion. I wanted one that had excellent quality but easy to use. What I got with this camera exceeded my expectations. I did not have time to view the CD that came with it but the manual was so easy to understand that after a couple of pictures I did not have think much about what I was doing. The camera did all of the work. I will view the CD to see everything that I can do with it. If you buy this camera make sure you order a memory card with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Maddie
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Takes great pictures-Many settings-Big, clear screen-8x zoom-attractive appearence-super easy to use-long battery lifeCons:- flash sometimes too bright- sometimes delay when you press the take button

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Tactix
Reviews.Content: I lost my camera on vacation and was looking for a replacement. I don't need anything to fancy, just durable and a good quality picture. I love this purchase, it's hard to believe the price. It has a burst shooting option, which allows you to move the camera in a circle while it takes pictures all around. A nice size viewing screen on the back. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Diane Mercier
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera about a month and so far it has been great.  My last camera used regular batteries and I was not real thrilled about a camera with a rechargable battery. I am used to changing out the batteries immediately when they die, not having to wait for the battery to recharge.  I did buy an extra battery to solve this problem.  The camera comes with a recharger. I have not had a chance to play with all the settings on the camera yet but what I have used has been great.  No complaints so far.

Reviews.Title: I Think you should get this product, because it is great (Revised)
Reviews.Author: aml11a
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is my favorite! With having used about 6 or 7 cameras for a period of time, this is my favorite. It may be expensive, but i think it is worth it. If you try to get a camera that is an easy set up (Like you are not) It is a fast camera, and holds many memory cards. I used 128, 2GB and 4GB, and they all worked! I think this is your number 1 camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Budget Camera!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for a camera in the *mid* price range, this is the camera for you! It takes incredible pictures that can be compared to many higher end cameras. If you're on the fence about this camera, pull the trigger on this one... you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Excellent & Easy
Reviews.Author: Ponda
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after researching & finding it very well reviewed.. the price was excellent as well. There are alot of features and choices one can make in settings, but for me, I use the 'Auto-Intelligent' mode & let the camera do the work. the colors are magnificent- I tested the camera on some vibrant New England foliage on both sunny & cloudy days.Easy, slim, great pictures. Works for me.

Reviews.Title: this is a great camera
Reviews.Author: zoweee
Reviews.Content: bought this for my wife....she wanted a simple point and shoot that was ready to take pictures whenever, wherever....the intelligent auto feature is great...no thinking, just point and shoot and it takes a great shot.....it does have the ability to change iso, white balance, etc... when you are not in the i.a. mode...great camera, nice zoom.

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: I find this camera easy to shoot on auto focus but it's somewhat complicated to reach the desired functions. I THINK i'm going to be happy with it when I can weed out the functions in an easy faction. I find myself getting into modes withgout trying.Pictures come out in different sizes and I'm yet to figure out why. The pics and movies are of excellent quality. Wish me luck.Joe

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera; Did a lot of research and landed on this
Reviews.Author: Albert Einstein "emc2"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera; Did a lot of research and landed on this. Did not disappoint at all. This camera met and exceeded all my expectations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace one that died.  Did the research on quality of picts and features.  Found this camera to be rated very good.  Am not disappointed in it.  Good wide angle on picts, clarity great, found it susceptible to shake when taking indoor with no flash.  Probably due to shutter speeds slowed down.  Great for what I needed and wanted and am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: For all the reviews...
Reviews.Author: Chakracon "Chakracon"
Reviews.Content: ...I read before purchasing this camera I have to say the quality of the pictures was disappointing to not good at all.  I wish, I wish, I wish I would've just kept my little Canon 6 megapixel - waaaa...

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Nana
Reviews.Content: With the impending birth of our grand daughter my daughter in law requested this camera for Christmas.  So far, no grand daughter or pictures LOL

Reviews.Title: not much of a camera
Reviews.Author: RB
Reviews.Content: This camera feels good in my hand, is nice and small, and I love the battery charger. To not have a long cord, but just a simple 2 prong arrangement is fabulous. And the big screen was great.But I was very disappointed with the quality of the shots. I particular the shots even in focus are not sharp, which really surprised me from a Leica lens, as i used to have leicas and the lenses were sharp as a tack. This must be their low end line. i'm a semi-pro, so i know wherefore I speak on this; I've sold many of my photos. In addition, the colors are not accurate, and the camera is just plain slow.No wonder so many people don't think they can take photos-so much equipment is inferior. Quite a let down for people I'm sure, as they would think it were they who are not good photographers, when the camra is largely at fault.I was so excited to have a camera that I could just put in my pocket that I was willing to forego having RAW. But this is not for me.I tried the larger one as well, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD, and that was better but not much. In comparison, the Nikon P6000 beats them both by a country mile, though it has a long cord on the battery charger, the battery runs out too quickly, and is a bit larger. Oh well. Worth the try but it's going back tomorrow with the other one..

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: M Khullar
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because my previous canon camera has its screen broken and I wanted a good point to shoot alternative. I selected this because the specifications written were good compared to camera of other companies for similar pricePros:1. Good specs on paper.Cons:1. Doesn't feel good in hand, it feels big and light for its size, it feels cheap in hand. I am not sure if some problem but I get a noise of something broken when I try to shake the camera.2. Not so good video quality.3. Most of the point to shoot pictures are taken inside the home with not so good light, and for that the picture quality of this camera isn't good.4. The user interface is awful, considering one rarely reads the booklet of these kind of cameras, you will have to read for this camera, because the user interface is not at all good.

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1-megapixel effective recording
8X optical zoom (4X digital zoom/32X total zoom)
2-11/16" LCD screen
Optical image stabilization
Sonic Speed AF for quick focusing on moving subjects
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
